channel.title: Diabetes on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections
channel.description: Recent content in Diabetes on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections

item.description: From 1987 to 2008, 13% of tetanus cases and 29% of tetanus deaths occurred in people sick with diabetes. Diabetics suffer from tetanus three times more often than the rest, and die four times more often. 15% of tetanus cases occur in intravenous drug users. Even if one were to assume that tetanus antibodies effectively neutralize the toxin, they would still need to get to the place of injury. And if the injury were to occur in a place with no sufficient blood supply, antibodies would not be able to get there.
